revised_title: Direct Observation of Crystal Lattices and Imperfections via Electron Microscopy
tldr: The authors successfully used electron microscopy to study crystal lattices and their imperfections in copper and platinum phthalocyanine. They observed resolved (20T) planes, dislocations, and unit steps in the crystal lattice. This method could potentially be extended to study imperfections in various materials related to properties like strength, plastic flow, and fracture.
